article_node.title: Hurricane Erin: Mass. beaches closed as powerful storm brings huge waves, treacherous rip currents
article_node.summary: Massachusetts beaches along the southern coast are closed to swimming as Hurricane Erin moves north, generating high surf and dangerous rip currents. Gov. Maura Healey and the National Weather Service warn residents to stay safe, noting high surf advisories through Friday and possible coastal flooding. The storm, currently a Category 2 hurricane, could strengthen to Category 3 or higher as it travels north, with wave heights up to 20 feet and galeâ€‘force winds affecting the Cape and Islands. Boaters and anglers are urged to exercise caution, and a wind advisory is in effect for parts of the region.
